content: Put a comfy chair or beanbags in a corner to create a reading nook. This is a great way to create a nice chill vibe in your room. Place your reading seat in a corner that catches the sun to make the reading nook extra warm and cosy. Put a box of books or magazines in your reading nook so they are easily accessible and add a lamp for extra lighting. [1] Use your reading chair or beanbags as extra seating when you’re hanging out with friends or watching movies. If you’re buying beanbags, consider getting a few so your friends can join you in the reading nook. Stack the beanbags on top of each other when you aren’t using them. Place a couch in your room to make a lounge area. If you have enough space, couches are a great way to accommodate lots of people and are perfect for hanging out. Place the couch opposite your bed or TV to make the room look balanced. Put a few cushions or throws on the couch to make it look extra comfy and inviting. [2] Check out garage sales to find cheap, second-hand couches. If the upholstery on the couch is a little ripped, simply place a throw or sheet over the couch to cover it. Hang up a TV or a projector to create a gaming or movie space. Watching TV and playing games together is a great way to hang out for hours. Place the TV in front of your bed or couch so that you can watch it in comfort. If you don’t normally have a TV in your bedroom, ask your parents if you can borrow the family TV for the day to hang out with your friends. [3] If you are using a projector, make sure that you have a blank wall to project it onto or hang up a sheet instead. Add throw pillows to turn your bed into extra seating. This is an awesome way to make your bed look extra cosy and inviting for your friends to sit on. If your bed is against a wall, consider placing the throw pillows against the wall to act as a backrest. This is a great option if you are sitting on your bed to watch a movie or TV show. [4] Opt for velvet or fluffy pillows to give your bed a luxurious feeling. Alternatively, pick waffle-textured or linen pillows for a minimal look. If you have lots of friends over, consider placing the throw cushions on the floor to create extra seating. Store your personal items in boxes to keep the space clutter-free. Try to keep your surfaces as clutter-free as possible to make your room look nice and clean. Store items that you use regularly in your drawers so that you can access them easily. Place items that you don’t use often, such as old books or craft supplies, into boxes and store them under your bed or in your wardrobe. [5] Label the boxes so that you know what each one contains. Choose a colour theme to decorate the space. This helps to make your room look cohesive and elegant. Decide what colours you want to use and then add accessories accordingly. For example, if you want a red, yellow, and white colour scheme, you could opt for white walls, yellow cushions and throws, and a red comforter on your bed. [6] Avoid using lots of colours, as this can make your room look cluttered and overwhelming. If you don’t want to have a colour theme, opt for a style theme instead, such as beachy, vintage, minimal, or boho. Use this theme to help you choose your bedroom accessories. Hang up fairy lights on your roof and walls to set a calming mood. Fairy lights instantly create a chill mood in your room – especially at night! Use small hooks or sticky-tak to attach the fairy lights to your walls or ceilings. If you aren’t allowed to attach things to your walls, consider draping the string of lights over your curtain rail, dresser, or headboard to create a similar effect. [7] Opt for yellow lights to create a warm feeling or white lights to create a pretty, starry look. Purchase fairy lights after Christmas to get a great deal. Display photos of you and your friends to highlight good times. Photos are a great inexpensive way to personalise your room and provide constant reminders of special memories. Place your photos in frames, peg them to a string and hang it up in your room, or simply sticky-tak them to the wall. Your friends will love seeing pictures of themselves on your wall! [8] If you are sticking the photos to the wall, consider placing them in a shape, such as a heart, circle, or diamond. Replace old photos with new photos occasionally to keep them up to date. If you’re creating a vintage theme in your room, search thrift stores for old photo frames. Places lamps around your room for mood lighting. This is a great way to set the mood for a movie night or a cosy girls night. Try adding desk lamps, lava lamps, floor lamps, or moon lamps to your room. Choose bulbs that are bright enough to allow you to see your friends' faces, as this will stop people getting too sleepy. [9] Search thrift stores, garage sales, or online auctions for inexpensive vintage lamps. If you don’t have power outlets in the right places, utilise extension cords to power the lamps. If you want your room to have a boho feel, opt for a lamp with lace on it. If you want a beachy look, pick a lamp that is made from driftwood. Hang up posters that express your unique interests. Posters are a great form of wall art and help to personalise your room. Frame your posters or use sticky-tak or pins to attach them to your wall. Band posters, inspirational posters, vintage posters, movie posters, superhero posters, and celebrity posters are cool options. [10] Consider having a poster wall that is filled with your favourite posters. Ask your parents before pinning anything to your walls. Search thrift stores to find vintage posters, or buy new posters online or from concerts Place a whiteboard on your wall for drawings and messages. Whiteboards can provide endless entertainment for you and your friends and are a great wall decoration. Draw pictures and cartoons, write messages to each other, or write down your to-do list on the board. Hang the board on a blank wall so it that is easy for multiple people to use it at the same time and have a few different whiteboard markers for you and your friends to use. [11] If you don’t have a whiteboard, consider pinning up a blackboard instead. If you aren’t allowed to hang up the whiteboard on the wall, lean it against your wall or rest it on your desk instead. Keep an old rag on hand to wipe the board clean. Put pretty rugs on the floor to brighten up the space. Rugs are an easy and inexpensive way to change how your floor looks. They also have the added benefit of making the floor a little comfier. Opt for thick and fluffy rugs to make the floor extra cosy or choose a woven or linen mat for a minimal look. [12] This is a great option if you want to have lots of people in your room but don’t have much seating. If your room has a nautical vibe, choose a bold blue-and-white patterned rug or a woven jute rug. Play your favourite music to set the mood. Music is a great way to set the atmosphere in your room. Opt for upbeat music if you want a pumping hangout or choose an acoustic or chill soundtrack if you want a more relaxed gathering. Play the music through speakers or straight from your phone or computer. [13] If you want to chat with your friends, make sure that the music is quiet enough to be able to hear each other. If you don’t know what to play, search for a hangout playlist on a music streaming site, such as Spotify or Apple Music. Buy games and activities that you and your friends can do together. Activities are a great way to ensure that nobody gets bored. Table tennis, board games, darts, and computer games are great options that can keep you and your friends occupied for hours. Set the activities up before your friends arrive or keep them on hand in case you get a little bored later in the day. [14] If you don’t have a lot of space in your room, try some vintage games, such as knucklebones, Ludo, or cards. Keep snacks on hand in case your friends get hungry. Food is a great way to get everybody in a good mood! Have some crisps, popcorn, fruit, crackers, or other delicious snacks prepared before your friends arrive. If you don’t want the snacks to get eaten straight away, put them in a cupboard and then bring them out once you get hungry. [15] Have a trash bag nearby to put your rubbish in so that your room doesn’t look messy from the food packets.

<div class="section sticky hasad" id="intro">
<h1 class="firstHeading no_toc"><a href="https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-(Teen-Girls)">How to Make Your Room a Hangout Spot (Teen Girls)</a></h1>
<div class="ss_check" id="expert_coauthor">
	
	Co-authored by <a class="staff_icon expert_coauthor_link" href="#article_info_section">
		wikiHow Staff</a> <span class="ss_pipe">|</span><a href="#references">15 References</a>
</div>
<p class="vertical_toc" id="method_toc">
<span class="header_toc">Explore this Article</span>
<a class="toc_method" href="#Arranging_the_Space_sub" id="">Arranging the Space</a>
<a class="toc_method" href="#Decorating_Your_Room_sub" id="">Decorating Your Room</a>
<a class="toc_method" href="#Hosting_Your_Friends_sub" id="">Hosting Your Friends</a>
<a class="" href="#Questions_and_Answers_sub" id="qa_toc">Questions & Answers</a>
<a class="" href="#relatedwikihows" id="rwh_toc">Related Articles</a>
</p>
<div hidden="" id="sp_icon_hover">
<div id="sp_icon_body">
		This article was co-authored by our trained team of editors and researchers who validated it for accuracy and comprehensiveness. Together, they cited information from <a href="#references">15 references</a>. <br/><br/>wikiHow's <a href="/Special:ArticleReviewers#wikihow%20content%20team%20managers">Content Management Team</a> carefully monitors the work from our editorial staff to ensure that each article meets our high quality standards.
		<a class="sp_learn_more_link" href="/wikiHow:About-wikiHow#Why_should_you_choose_wikiHow_first.3F_sub">Learn more...</a>
</div>
</div>
<p>Making your room a great hangout spot for your friends is a fun and easy process! Create different spaces within your room to make it into a fun and inviting atmosphere. Express your own unique style and decorate your room with lights, photos, posters, and a whiteboard. Be prepared with music, snacks, activities, and movies to keep you and your friends occupied for hours. Have fun and enjoy transforming your room into the perfect hangout spot.</p>

<h2 class="hidden"><span class="mw-headline" id="Steps">Steps</span></h2>
<a class="anchor" name="Arranging_the_Space_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky steps_first">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>1</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Arranging_the_Space">Arranging the Space</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_1">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-(Teen-Girls)-Step-1-Version-4.jpg?ajax=true&aid=149958" href="#/Image:Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-(Teen-Girls)-Step-1-Version-4.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make Your Room a Hangout Spot (Teen Girls) Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/db/Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-1-Version-4.jpg/aid149958-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-1-Version-4.jpg" height="546" id="img_34a436a2cc" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_34a436a2cc')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make Your Room a Hangout Spot (Teen Girls) Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/db/Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-1-Version-4.jpg/aid149958-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-1-Version-4.jpg" width="728"/></noscript>
<script>WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');</script></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Put a comfy chair or beanbags in a corner to create a reading nook.</b> This is a great way to create a nice chill vibe in your room. Place your reading seat in a corner that catches the sun to make the reading nook extra warm and cosy. Put a box of books or magazines in your reading nook so they are easily accessible and add a lamp for extra lighting.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 1" class="reference" id="_ref-1"><a href="#_note-1">[1]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Use your reading chair or beanbags as extra seating when you’re hanging out with friends or watching movies.</li>
<li>If you’re buying beanbags, consider getting a few so your friends can join you in the reading nook. Stack the beanbags on top of each other when you aren’t using them.</li>
</ul>
<script>WH.performance.mark('step1_rendered');</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-(Teen-Girls)-Step-2-Version-4.jpg?ajax=true&aid=149958" href="#/Image:Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-(Teen-Girls)-Step-2-Version-4.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make Your Room a Hangout Spot (Teen Girls) Step 2" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1e/Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-2-Version-4.jpg/aid149958-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-2-Version-4.jpg" height="546" id="img_347fdb934d" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_347fdb934d')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make Your Room a Hangout Spot (Teen Girls) Step 2" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1e/Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-2-Version-4.jpg/aid149958-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-2-Version-4.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Place a couch in your room to make a lounge area.</b> If you have enough space, couches are a great way to accommodate lots of people and are perfect for hanging out. Place the couch opposite your bed or TV to make the room look balanced. Put a few cushions or throws on the couch to make it look extra comfy and inviting.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 2" class="reference" id="_ref-2"><a href="#_note-2">[2]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Check out garage sales to find cheap, second-hand couches. If the upholstery on the couch is a little ripped, simply place a throw or sheet over the couch to cover it.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-(Teen-Girls)-Step-3-Version-4.jpg?ajax=true&aid=149958" href="#/Image:Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-(Teen-Girls)-Step-3-Version-4.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make Your Room a Hangout Spot (Teen Girls) Step 3" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c1/Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-3-Version-4.jpg/aid149958-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-3-Version-4.jpg" height="546" id="img_457157712d" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_457157712d')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make Your Room a Hangout Spot (Teen Girls) Step 3" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c1/Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-3-Version-4.jpg/aid149958-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-3-Version-4.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Hang up a TV or a projector to create a gaming or movie space.</b> Watching TV and playing games together is a great way to hang out for hours. Place the TV in front of your bed or couch so that you can watch it in comfort. If you don’t normally have a TV in your bedroom, ask your parents if you can borrow the family TV for the day to hang out with your friends. <sup aria-label="Link to Reference 3" class="reference" id="_ref-3"><a href="#_note-3">[3]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>If you are using a projector, make sure that you have a blank wall to project it onto or hang up a sheet instead.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-(Teen-Girls)-Step-4-Version-4.jpg?ajax=true&aid=149958" href="#/Image:Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-(Teen-Girls)-Step-4-Version-4.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make Your Room a Hangout Spot (Teen Girls) Step 4" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7e/Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-4-Version-4.jpg/aid149958-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-4-Version-4.jpg" height="546" id="img_81d7becd23" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_81d7becd23')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make Your Room a Hangout Spot (Teen Girls) Step 4" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7e/Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-4-Version-4.jpg/aid149958-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-4-Version-4.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Add throw pillows to turn your bed into extra seating.</b> This is an awesome way to make your bed look extra cosy and inviting for your friends to sit on. If your bed is against a wall, consider placing the throw pillows against the wall to act as a backrest. This is a great option if you are sitting on your bed to watch a movie or TV show.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 4" class="reference" id="_ref-4"><a href="#_note-4">[4]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Opt for velvet or fluffy pillows to give your bed a luxurious feeling. Alternatively, pick waffle-textured or linen pillows for a minimal look.</li>
<li>If you have lots of friends over, consider placing the throw cushions on the floor to create extra seating.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-(Teen-Girls)-Step-5-Version-4.jpg?ajax=true&aid=149958" href="#/Image:Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-(Teen-Girls)-Step-5-Version-4.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make Your Room a Hangout Spot (Teen Girls) Step 5" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/87/Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-5-Version-4.jpg/aid149958-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-5-Version-4.jpg" height="546" id="img_bb4c276151" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_bb4c276151')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make Your Room a Hangout Spot (Teen Girls) Step 5" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/87/Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-5-Version-4.jpg/aid149958-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-5-Version-4.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Store your personal items in boxes to keep the space clutter-free.</b> Try to keep your surfaces as clutter-free as possible to make your room look nice and clean. Store items that you use regularly in your drawers so that you can access them easily. Place items that you don’t use often, such as old books or craft supplies, into boxes and store them under your bed or in your wardrobe.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 5" class="reference" id="_ref-5"><a href="#_note-5">[5]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Label the boxes so that you know what each one contains.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adtargetid="methodad" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-apsload="1" data-channels="6381149051,3492389196" data-lateload="0" data-loaded="0" data-service="dfp" data-slot="" data-viewablerefresh="1">

</div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addBodyAd('methodad')</script>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Decorating_Your_Room_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>2</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Decorating_Your_Room">Decorating Your Room</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_2">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-(Teen-Girls)-Step-6-Version-4.jpg?ajax=true&aid=149958" href="#/Image:Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-(Teen-Girls)-Step-6-Version-4.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make Your Room a Hangout Spot (Teen Girls) Step 6" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/16/Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-6-Version-4.jpg/aid149958-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-6-Version-4.jpg" height="546" id="img_df88f3c72e" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_df88f3c72e')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make Your Room a Hangout Spot (Teen Girls) Step 6" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/16/Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-6-Version-4.jpg/aid149958-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-6-Version-4.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Choose a colour theme to decorate the space.</b> This helps to make your room look cohesive and elegant. Decide what colours you want to use and then add accessories accordingly. For example, if you want a red, yellow, and white colour scheme, you could opt for white walls, yellow cushions and throws, and a red comforter on your bed.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 6" class="reference" id="_ref-6"><a href="#_note-6">[6]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Avoid using lots of colours, as this can make your room look cluttered and overwhelming.</li>
<li>If you don’t want to have a colour theme, opt for a style theme instead, such as beachy, vintage, minimal, or boho. Use this theme to help you choose your bedroom accessories.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-(Teen-Girls)-Step-7-Version-5.jpg?ajax=true&aid=149958" href="#/Image:Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-(Teen-Girls)-Step-7-Version-5.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make Your Room a Hangout Spot (Teen Girls) Step 7" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d3/Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-7-Version-5.jpg/aid149958-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-7-Version-5.jpg" height="546" id="img_14a2feba72" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_14a2feba72')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make Your Room a Hangout Spot (Teen Girls) Step 7" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d3/Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-7-Version-5.jpg/aid149958-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-7-Version-5.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Hang up fairy lights on your roof and walls to set a calming mood.</b> Fairy lights instantly create a chill mood in your room – especially at night! Use small hooks or sticky-tak to attach the fairy lights to your walls or ceilings. If you aren’t allowed to attach things to your walls, consider draping the string of lights over your curtain rail, dresser, or headboard to create a similar effect.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 7" class="reference" id="_ref-7"><a href="#_note-7">[7]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Opt for yellow lights to create a warm feeling or white lights to create a pretty, starry look.</li>
<li>Purchase fairy lights after Christmas to get a great deal.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-(Teen-Girls)-Step-8-Version-4.jpg?ajax=true&aid=149958" href="#/Image:Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-(Teen-Girls)-Step-8-Version-4.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make Your Room a Hangout Spot (Teen Girls) Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a0/Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-8-Version-4.jpg/aid149958-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-8-Version-4.jpg" height="546" id="img_9b69bbac15" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_9b69bbac15')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make Your Room a Hangout Spot (Teen Girls) Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a0/Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-8-Version-4.jpg/aid149958-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-8-Version-4.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Display photos of you and your friends to highlight good times.</b> Photos are a great inexpensive way to personalise your room and provide constant reminders of special memories. Place your photos in frames, peg them to a string and hang it up in your room, or simply sticky-tak them to the wall. Your friends will love seeing pictures of themselves on your wall!<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 8" class="reference" id="_ref-8"><a href="#_note-8">[8]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>If you are sticking the photos to the wall, consider placing them in a shape, such as a heart, circle, or diamond.</li>
<li>Replace old photos with new photos occasionally to keep them up to date.</li>
<li>If you’re creating a vintage theme in your room, search thrift stores for old photo frames.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-(Teen-Girls)-Step-9-Version-4.jpg?ajax=true&aid=149958" href="#/Image:Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-(Teen-Girls)-Step-9-Version-4.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make Your Room a Hangout Spot (Teen Girls) Step 9" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e5/Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-9-Version-4.jpg/aid149958-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-9-Version-4.jpg" height="546" id="img_24c0ce2bc1" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_24c0ce2bc1')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make Your Room a Hangout Spot (Teen Girls) Step 9" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e5/Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-9-Version-4.jpg/aid149958-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-9-Version-4.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Places lamps around your room for mood lighting.</b> This is a great way to set the mood for a movie night or a cosy girls night. Try adding desk lamps, lava lamps, floor lamps, or moon lamps to your room. Choose bulbs that are bright enough to allow you to see your friends' faces, as this will stop people getting too sleepy.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 9" class="reference" id="_ref-9"><a href="#_note-9">[9]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Search thrift stores, garage sales, or online auctions for inexpensive vintage lamps.</li>
<li>If you don’t have power outlets in the right places, utilise extension cords to power the lamps.</li>
<li>If you want your room to have a boho feel, opt for a lamp with lace on it. If you want a beachy look, pick a lamp that is made from driftwood.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-(Teen-Girls)-Step-10-Version-6.jpg?ajax=true&aid=149958" href="#/Image:Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-(Teen-Girls)-Step-10-Version-6.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make Your Room a Hangout Spot (Teen Girls) Step 10" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/56/Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-10-Version-6.jpg/aid149958-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-10-Version-6.jpg" height="546" id="img_853b7423a8" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_853b7423a8')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make Your Room a Hangout Spot (Teen Girls) Step 10" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/56/Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-10-Version-6.jpg/aid149958-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-10-Version-6.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Hang up posters that express your unique interests.</b> Posters are a great form of wall art and help to personalise your room. Frame your posters or use sticky-tak or pins to attach them to your wall. Band posters, inspirational posters, vintage posters, movie posters, superhero posters, and celebrity posters are cool options.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 10" class="reference" id="_ref-10"><a href="#_note-10">[10]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Consider having a poster wall that is filled with your favourite posters.</li>
<li>Ask your parents before pinning anything to your walls.</li>
<li>Search thrift stores to find vintage posters, or buy new posters online or from concerts</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-(Teen-Girls)-Step-11-Version-6.jpg?ajax=true&aid=149958" href="#/Image:Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-(Teen-Girls)-Step-11-Version-6.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make Your Room a Hangout Spot (Teen Girls) Step 11" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/07/Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-11-Version-6.jpg/aid149958-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-11-Version-6.jpg" height="546" id="img_59945b46d6" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_59945b46d6')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make Your Room a Hangout Spot (Teen Girls) Step 11" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/07/Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-11-Version-6.jpg/aid149958-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-11-Version-6.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Place a whiteboard on your wall for drawings and messages.</b> Whiteboards can provide endless entertainment for you and your friends and are a great wall decoration. Draw pictures and cartoons, write messages to each other, or write down your to-do list on the board. Hang the board on a blank wall so it that is easy for multiple people to use it at the same time and have a few different whiteboard markers for you and your friends to use.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 11" class="reference" id="_ref-11"><a href="#_note-11">[11]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>If you don’t have a whiteboard, consider pinning up a blackboard instead.</li>
<li>If you aren’t allowed to hang up the whiteboard on the wall, lean it against your wall or rest it on your desk instead.</li>
<li>Keep an old rag on hand to wipe the board clean.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-(Teen-Girls)-Step-12-Version-5.jpg?ajax=true&aid=149958" href="#/Image:Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-(Teen-Girls)-Step-12-Version-5.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make Your Room a Hangout Spot (Teen Girls) Step 12" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cb/Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-12-Version-5.jpg/aid149958-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-12-Version-5.jpg" height="546" id="img_db2be84285" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_db2be84285')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make Your Room a Hangout Spot (Teen Girls) Step 12" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cb/Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-12-Version-5.jpg/aid149958-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-12-Version-5.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 7" class="step_num">7</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_7"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Put pretty rugs on the floor to brighten up the space.</b> Rugs are an easy and inexpensive way to change how your floor looks. They also have the added benefit of making the floor a little comfier. Opt for thick and fluffy rugs to make the floor extra cosy or choose a woven or linen mat for a minimal look.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 12" class="reference" id="_ref-12"><a href="#_note-12">[12]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>This is a great option if you want to have lots of people in your room but don’t have much seating.</li>
<li>If your room has a nautical vibe, choose a bold blue-and-white patterned rug or a woven jute rug.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div id="tocad_wrap">

<script>WH.desktopAds.addTOCAd('tocad')</script>
</div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Hosting_Your_Friends_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>3</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Hosting_Your_Friends">Hosting Your Friends</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_3">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-(Teen-Girls)-Step-13-Version-5.jpg?ajax=true&aid=149958" href="#/Image:Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-(Teen-Girls)-Step-13-Version-5.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make Your Room a Hangout Spot (Teen Girls) Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/22/Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-13-Version-5.jpg/aid149958-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-13-Version-5.jpg" height="546" id="img_49f99887e7" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_49f99887e7')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make Your Room a Hangout Spot (Teen Girls) Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/22/Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-13-Version-5.jpg/aid149958-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-13-Version-5.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Play your favourite music to set the mood.</b> Music is a great way to set the atmosphere in your room. Opt for upbeat music if you want a pumping hangout or choose an acoustic or chill soundtrack if you want a more relaxed gathering. Play the music through speakers or straight from your phone or computer.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 13" class="reference" id="_ref-13"><a href="#_note-13">[13]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>If you want to chat with your friends, make sure that the music is quiet enough to be able to hear each other.</li>
<li>If you don’t know what to play, search for a hangout playlist on a music streaming site, such as Spotify or Apple Music.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-(Teen-Girls)-Step-14-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=149958" href="#/Image:Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-(Teen-Girls)-Step-14-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make Your Room a Hangout Spot (Teen Girls) Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/36/Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid149958-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-14-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_575e5217c1" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_575e5217c1')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make Your Room a Hangout Spot (Teen Girls) Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/36/Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid149958-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-14-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Buy games and activities that you and your friends can do together.</b> Activities are a great way to ensure that nobody gets bored. Table tennis, board games, darts, and computer games are great options that can keep you and your friends occupied for hours. Set the activities up before your friends arrive or keep them on hand in case you get a little bored later in the day.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 14" class="reference" id="_ref-14"><a href="#_note-14">[14]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>If you don’t have a lot of space in your room, try some vintage games, such as knucklebones, Ludo, or cards.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage final_li">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-(Teen-Girls)-Step-15.jpg?ajax=true&aid=149958" href="#/Image:Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-(Teen-Girls)-Step-15.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make Your Room a Hangout Spot (Teen Girls) Step 15" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ef/Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-15.jpg/aid149958-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-15.jpg" height="546" id="img_42627a9464" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_42627a9464')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make Your Room a Hangout Spot (Teen Girls) Step 15" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ef/Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-15.jpg/aid149958-v4-728px-Make-Your-Room-a-Hangout-Spot-%28Teen-Girls%29-Step-15.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Keep snacks on hand in case your friends get hungry.</b> Food is a great way to get everybody in a good mood! Have some crisps, popcorn, fruit, crackers, or other delicious snacks prepared before your friends arrive. If you don’t want the snacks to get eaten straight away, put them in a cupboard and then bring them out once you get hungry.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 15" class="reference" id="_ref-15"><a href="#_note-15">[15]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Have a trash bag nearby to put your rubbish in so that your room doesn’t look messy from the food packets.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Questions_and_Answers_sub"></a>
<div class="qa section sticky qa_show_unanswered_questions" data-aid="149958" data-few_contribs="1" data-search_enabled="0">
<h2>
<div class="altblock"></div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="qa_headline">Community Q&A</span>
</h2>
<div class="section_text" id="qa">
<div id="qa_answered_questions_container">
<div id="qa_aq_search_container">

</div>

<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="429034" data-caid="429907" data-cqid="429051" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="2383079" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="1" data-votes_up="16">

<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>

<div class="qa_user_name"></div>

</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Sure, rugs work best on low pile carpet. </div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">

<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>

</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="301569" data-caid="302442" data-cqid="301586" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="1056088" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="2" data-votes_up="21">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">What if I can't afford anything cool?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Look for things that are "gently used" at garage sales, thrift stores, and flea markets where you can haggle prices.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">Yes</a>
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>2</span></a>
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>21</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="327856" data-caid="328729" data-cqid="327873" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="1001866" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="1" data-votes_up="14">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">What do I do if I'm renting?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Well, you probably won't be able to paint, but there is still plenty you can do to spruce up your room. Check thrift stores for some cool inexpensive stuff, and get creative.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">Yes</a>
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>1</span></a>
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>14</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="458771" data-caid="459644" data-cqid="458788" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="2451411" data-submitter_id="4917572" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="2" data-votes_up="16">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">Could my theme be the galaxy cause I like the way it looks on pictures?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle" style="background-image:url(https://www.wikihow.com/images/avatarOut/a/a8/4917572.jpg?20180527000720)"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"><span class="qa_user_link" data-href="/User:Nitya-Pokharel">Nitya Pokharel</span></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Sure! You could get galaxy bedding, wallpaper, pictures, shelves, or and much more. Galaxy would be a great theme for a hangout spot!</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">Yes</a>
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>2</span></a>
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>16</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="382078" data-caid="382951" data-cqid="382095" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="2020928" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="2" data-votes_up="15">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">What if I can't pick a theme for my room?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">If you can't pick a theme for your room, try choosing a color scheme instead. Often it's easier to design a room based on a color palate rather than a theme. </div>

title: How to Make Your Room a Hangout Spot (Teen Girls)
content_html:
Put a comfy chair or beanbags in a corner to create a reading nook. This is a great way to create a nice chill vibe in your room. Place your reading seat in a corner that catches the sun to make the reading nook extra warm and cosy. Put a box of books or magazines in your reading nook so they are easily accessible and add a lamp for extra lighting.[1]
  • Use your reading chair or beanbags as extra seating when you’re hanging out with friends or watching movies.
  • If you’re buying beanbags, consider getting a few so your friends can join you in the reading nook. Stack the beanbags on top of each other when you aren’t using them.
Place a couch in your room to make a lounge area. If you have enough space, couches are a great way to accommodate lots of people and are perfect for hanging out. Place the couch opposite your bed or TV to make the room look balanced. Put a few cushions or throws on the couch to make it look extra comfy and inviting.[2]
  • Check out garage sales to find cheap, second-hand couches. If the upholstery on the couch is a little ripped, simply place a throw or sheet over the couch to cover it.
Hang up a TV or a projector to create a gaming or movie space. Watching TV and playing games together is a great way to hang out for hours. Place the TV in front of your bed or couch so that you can watch it in comfort. If you don’t normally have a TV in your bedroom, ask your parents if you can borrow the family TV for the day to hang out with your friends. [3]
  • If you are using a projector, make sure that you have a blank wall to project it onto or hang up a sheet instead.
Add throw pillows to turn your bed into extra seating. This is an awesome way to make your bed look extra cosy and inviting for your friends to sit on. If your bed is against a wall, consider placing the throw pillows against the wall to act as a backrest. This is a great option if you are sitting on your bed to watch a movie or TV show.[4]
  • Opt for velvet or fluffy pillows to give your bed a luxurious feeling. Alternatively, pick waffle-textured or linen pillows for a minimal look.
  • If you have lots of friends over, consider placing the throw cushions on the floor to create extra seating.
Store your personal items in boxes to keep the space clutter-free. Try to keep your surfaces as clutter-free as possible to make your room look nice and clean. Store items that you use regularly in your drawers so that you can access them easily. Place items that you don’t use often, such as old books or craft supplies, into boxes and store them under your bed or in your wardrobe.[5]
  • Label the boxes so that you know what each one contains.
Choose a colour theme to decorate the space. This helps to make your room look cohesive and elegant. Decide what colours you want to use and then add accessories accordingly. For example, if you want a red, yellow, and white colour scheme, you could opt for white walls, yellow cushions and throws, and a red comforter on your bed.[6]
  • Avoid using lots of colours, as this can make your room look cluttered and overwhelming.
  • If you don’t want to have a colour theme, opt for a style theme instead, such as beachy, vintage, minimal, or boho. Use this theme to help you choose your bedroom accessories.
Hang up fairy lights on your roof and walls to set a calming mood. Fairy lights instantly create a chill mood in your room – especially at night! Use small hooks or sticky-tak to attach the fairy lights to your walls or ceilings. If you aren’t allowed to attach things to your walls, consider draping the string of lights over your curtain rail, dresser, or headboard to create a similar effect.[7]
  • Opt for yellow lights to create a warm feeling or white lights to create a pretty, starry look.
  • Purchase fairy lights after Christmas to get a great deal.
Display photos of you and your friends to highlight good times. Photos are a great inexpensive way to personalise your room and provide constant reminders of special memories. Place your photos in frames, peg them to a string and hang it up in your room, or simply sticky-tak them to the wall. Your friends will love seeing pictures of themselves on your wall![8]
  • If you are sticking the photos to the wall, consider placing them in a shape, such as a heart, circle, or diamond.
  • Replace old photos with new photos occasionally to keep them up to date.
  • If you’re creating a vintage theme in your room, search thrift stores for old photo frames.
Places lamps around your room for mood lighting. This is a great way to set the mood for a movie night or a cosy girls night. Try adding desk lamps, lava lamps, floor lamps, or moon lamps to your room. Choose bulbs that are bright enough to allow you to see your friends' faces, as this will stop people getting too sleepy.[9]
  • Search thrift stores, garage sales, or online auctions for inexpensive vintage lamps.
  • If you don’t have power outlets in the right places, utilise extension cords to power the lamps.
  • If you want your room to have a boho feel, opt for a lamp with lace on it. If you want a beachy look, pick a lamp that is made from driftwood.
Hang up posters that express your unique interests. Posters are a great form of wall art and help to personalise your room. Frame your posters or use sticky-tak or pins to attach them to your wall. Band posters, inspirational posters, vintage posters, movie posters, superhero posters, and celebrity posters are cool options.[10]
  • Consider having a poster wall that is filled with your favourite posters.
  • Ask your parents before pinning anything to your walls.
  • Search thrift stores to find vintage posters, or buy new posters online or from concerts
Place a whiteboard on your wall for drawings and messages. Whiteboards can provide endless entertainment for you and your friends and are a great wall decoration. Draw pictures and cartoons, write messages to each other, or write down your to-do list on the board. Hang the board on a blank wall so it that is easy for multiple people to use it at the same time and have a few different whiteboard markers for you and your friends to use.[11]
  • If you don’t have a whiteboard, consider pinning up a blackboard instead.
  • If you aren’t allowed to hang up the whiteboard on the wall, lean it against your wall or rest it on your desk instead.
  • Keep an old rag on hand to wipe the board clean.
Put pretty rugs on the floor to brighten up the space. Rugs are an easy and inexpensive way to change how your floor looks. They also have the added benefit of making the floor a little comfier. Opt for thick and fluffy rugs to make the floor extra cosy or choose a woven or linen mat for a minimal look.[12]
  • This is a great option if you want to have lots of people in your room but don’t have much seating.
  • If your room has a nautical vibe, choose a bold blue-and-white patterned rug or a woven jute rug.
Play your favourite music to set the mood. Music is a great way to set the atmosphere in your room. Opt for upbeat music if you want a pumping hangout or choose an acoustic or chill soundtrack if you want a more relaxed gathering. Play the music through speakers or straight from your phone or computer.[13]
  • If you want to chat with your friends, make sure that the music is quiet enough to be able to hear each other.
  • If you don’t know what to play, search for a hangout playlist on a music streaming site, such as Spotify or Apple Music.
Buy games and activities that you and your friends can do together. Activities are a great way to ensure that nobody gets bored. Table tennis, board games, darts, and computer games are great options that can keep you and your friends occupied for hours. Set the activities up before your friends arrive or keep them on hand in case you get a little bored later in the day.[14]
  • If you don’t have a lot of space in your room, try some vintage games, such as knucklebones, Ludo, or cards.
Keep snacks on hand in case your friends get hungry. Food is a great way to get everybody in a good mood! Have some crisps, popcorn, fruit, crackers, or other delicious snacks prepared before your friends arrive. If you don’t want the snacks to get eaten straight away, put them in a cupboard and then bring them out once you get hungry.[15]
  • Have a trash bag nearby to put your rubbish in so that your room doesn’t look messy from the food packets.
